title: Restore Sweta romantic copy in App content

requirements.summary: Revert all user-facing copy in frontend/src/App.tsx to the original Sweta romantic version (Sweta name, romantic framing, and 29 November date), removing any remaining Kavya ji/Rose Day/friendship-only text and aligning relevant alt text.
acceptanceCriteria: All visible user-facing text in `frontend/src/App.tsx` refers to the recipient as “Sweta” (not “Kavya ji”).
The story section references “29 November” (not “Rose Day”).
Section titles and letter/signature are in the romantic version (e.g., titles like “Our Love Story”, romantic phrasing, and boyfriend/romantic signature if present in the original).
All relevant image `alt` text in `frontend/src/App.tsx` uses “Sweta” where a person-name is used, and does not mention “Kavya ji”.

file_operations.description: Update/verify all hardcoded strings and any name-referencing `alt` text to ensure the page consistently uses “Sweta”, retains romantic relationship framing, and references the occasion/date as “29 November”, with no remaining mentions of “Kavya ji”, “Rose Day”, or friendship-only wording. Keep existing images and structure unchanged (text/alt-text-only changes).
